intro: Hieracium discors, commonly known as the common meadow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium discors is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
